title: Citibank Partners with Carrefour in Bahrain
summary: Manama, Bahrain - Citibank Bahrain announced a key partnership with Carrefour to make shopping at one of the largest hypermarkets in the Kingdom a more pleasant experience for Citibank card members. As part of the offering, Citibank credit card members can purchase any electronic item from Carrefour and sign up to pay in interest free monthly installments over three or six months.
tag-1: Citibank Partners with Carrefour in Bahrain
tag-2: Manama, Bahrain – Citibank Bahrain announced a key partnership with Carrefour to make shopping at one of the largest hypermarkets in the Kingdom a more pleasant experience for Citibank card members. As part of the offering, Citibank credit card members can purchase any electronic item from Carrefour and sign up to pay in interest free monthly installments over three or six months.
tag-3: Speaking about the partnership, Mr. Navneet Kampani, Citibank Bahrain Consumer Banking Head, said: "We have been a long term partner with Carrefour and the launch of this promotion further provides an impetus to our partnership. We bring to the table choice and affordability for our customers who can now enjoy a wide range of consumer durables and electronic items at Carrefour. We are pleased to have Carrefour onboard as the first and only hypermarket in our interest free installment feature".
tag-4: Citi has been in the Middle East for nearly 50 years and offers consumer-banking services in Bahrain, UAE and Egypt. In the Kingdom of Bahrain alone, Citibank, the consumer banking arm of Citi, has had a presence for the past 25 years. Today, the bank is a major player in Bahrain's credit card market and a leading provider of Wealth Management and Consumer Credit services.
tag-5: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
